summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from January to May 2020 between attorneys from the law firm Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP and an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York. The emails concern a formal request for information from the Department of Justice relating to Jeffrey Epstein, made in connection with pending litigation against Epstein's estate. The parties coordinate calls and discuss document production.

persons.name: Alexandra Conlon
persons.role: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding a request for information about Jeffrey Epstein for pending litigation against his estate. She sends emails on behalf of Roberta Kaplan.

persons.name: Kate L. Doniger
persons.role: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office to follow up on and schedule calls regarding the request for information about Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Roberta Kaplan
persons.role: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP
persons.context: Lead attorney on the pending litigation against Jeffrey Epstein's estate. The formal Touhy letter requesting documents from the DOJ is sent on her behalf.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the information request. The documents are being sought in connection with pending litigation against his estate.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at the same law firm (Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP) working on the same case. Conlon sends emails on Kaplan's behalf.

events.title: Initial Attorney Call
events.description: A conversation took place between attorneys from Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the request for information on Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: DOJ Document Production
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent a letter and a set of documents in response to the request for information relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The document file was encrypted.

events.title: Submission of Touhy Request
events.description: Attorneys for Roberta Kaplan submitted a formal Touhy letter and supporting exhibit to the Department of Justice, requesting documents in connection with litigation against Jeffrey Epstein's estate.

events.title: Initial DOJ Contact
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sent an initial letter to Roberta Kaplan regarding her request for information relating to Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Private attorneys from Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP were engaged in active litigation against Jeffrey Epstein's estate as of early 2020.
The attorneys made a formal request to the U.S. Department of Justice for information relating to Jeffrey Epstein using a Touhy request process.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York produced a set of documents in response to this request in April 2020.
The email chain shows ongoing coordination and follow-up between private counsel and federal prosecutors regarding the Epstein-related information.
The identity of the specific Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) handling the request is redacted in the document.
